title: How to Cook Chinese Fried Rice in Malaysian Style

steps.headline: Crush the garlic and chop it a little bit.
Slice the bird's eye chilly.
steps.description: The quantity depends on whether you want it to be spicy or not.

steps.headline: Cut the cauliflower into bite sizes.
Remove the shrimp head and the shell.
Slice the chicken into tiny bite sizes.
Heat the wok and add some margarine.
steps.description: Make a scrambled egg and put it aside.

steps.headline: Add a little bit more margarine again.
steps.description: Cook the shrimp and pieces of chicken.

steps.headline: Add the garlic.
steps.description: Stir it until it gives out a smell, and then add the bird's eye chillies.

steps.headline: Stir it a little bit, and then add the veggies.
Add the rice and stir it nicely.
Add some oyster sauce, chicken stock and a pinch of salt.

text: Crush the garlic and chop it a little bit.  Slice the bird's eye chilly. The quantity depends on whether you want it to be spicy or not. Cut the cauliflower into bite sizes.  Remove the shrimp head and the shell.  Slice the chicken into tiny bite sizes.  Heat the wok and add some margarine. Make a scrambled egg and put it aside. Add a little bit more margarine again. Cook the shrimp and pieces of chicken. Add the garlic. Stir it until it gives out a smell, and then add the bird's eye chillies. Stir it a little bit, and then add the veggies.  Add the rice and stir it nicely.  Add some oyster sauce, chicken stock and a pinch of salt. Stir it thoroughly and nicely. Finished.
